etymologies: late Middle English: from Anglo-Norman French and Old French, representing medieval Latin suffraganeus ‘assistant (bishop)’, from Latin suffragium (see suffrage)

definitions: a bishop appointed to help a diocesan bishop

examples.text: Ealdred became suffragan to Lyfing of Worcester

shortDefinitions: bishop appointed to help diocesan bishop

definitions: a bishop in relation to his archbishop or metropolitan.
shortDefinitions: bishop in relation to his archbishop or metropolitan
